channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

Report X-2023100806

  • Description: DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS USED BY RESPONDER AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded the package handler noticed the corner of the box was wet. DescribePack: Loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered the package was placed inside a tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was wet and had a strong odor. after inspection cap was found leaking and the safety seal was broken. DescribePack: Safety seal under the cap of the bottle was broken. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat tote and left under the ventilation fan.

item.title: Report X-2023100278
item.description:
Report X-2023100278

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: SPOKANE VALLEY
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: BC OF ONE OF OUR CONTRACTORS TOLD ME THAT THERE WAS A PACKAGE IN HIS WORK AREA THAT WAS LEAKING WHITE GRANULES, WENT TO INSPECT AND IMMEDIATELY TRANSFERED TO RED LINED TOTE AND BROUGHT TO QA. SDS PULLED UP AND DISCOVERED IT WAS HAZARDOUS. DescribePack: 2 .5 INCH PUNCTURES, 1 ON EACH BAG, A SMALL PINHOLE SIZED PUNCTURE ON 1 OF THE BAGS AS WELL DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TRANSFERED TO RED LINED TOTE

item.title: Report X-2023100099
item.description:
Report X-2023100099

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS A SPILLAGE CALLED TO DMP FROM DOOR 16, RESPONDER USED PPE AND THE DECISION TREE AND WENT TO RESPOND THE CALL. WHEN ARRIVED RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DESICION TREE AND PROCEEDED TO FOLLOW THE CONTAINMENT SHEET FOR FLAMMABLE LIQUID, FOLLOWED THE PROCESS, PUT IT IN SPILL TRAY, AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023090022
item.description:
Report X-2023090022

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The TILX 730722 was found on 8/16/23 in the Tacoma Railyard with wetness on the tank car jacket by yard personnel. The car was isolated and notifications were made. BNSF Hazmat contractor responded and found the manway seal in place, however the swing bolts were less than tool tight and contributed to a release of fuel through the manway sealing area. Responders inspected and cleaned the gasket and resecured the manway lid. Degreaser and rags were used to clean residue from the tank car jacket. A small amount of impacted soil was removed. Loss estimate is based upon observations made by contract responders.
